scene.name: intro
scene.line: I was playing in that empty cabin, and they came by. They asked about Dr. Truman. I know where he went, but I didn't tell them.
scene.option: Did you talk about anything else?
Where did Dr. Truman go?

scene.name: dr-truman
scene.line: It's a secret. Ezra told me, and I can't tell anyone else.
scene.option: What else did the strangers say?
Who is Ezra?

scene.name: ezra
scene.line: He's my age. He doesn't really live here. He's just passing through with his brother, Julian. First they're going to help us, but I can't say any more about that. We have a lot of secrets.

scene.name: anything-else
scene.line: The lady asked me about my parents and I told them they were upstairs in the greenhouse. Do you want to hear a weird story?
scene.option: I'm a little busy.
Of course I do.

scene.name: no-weird-story
scene.line: OK. Bye.

scene.name: weird-story
scene.line: The old man asked me about the cabin. He said it looked like another house he knew, and he wanted to know where it came from. I told him nobody lived there, so he went inside. He took a long time exploring. When he came back out he told me all about it.
scene.option: Where was the other house he knew?
What did he find in the cabin?

scene.name: other-house
scene.line: I don't remember. He seemed sad.
scene.option: Was it the home he grew up in?
Was it the home of a friend?
Was it a place where something sad happened?

scene.name: childhood-home
scene.line: Yeah, I remember: he lived there with his mom. She was sick. She stayed in her room all the time.
Yeah, I remember: he lived there with his mom. She was sick. She was always sweeping, she said the dust was trying to smother them.
Yeah, I remember: he lived there with his mom. She was a painter. She only slept in the daytime.
Yeah, I remember: he lived there with his dad. His dad was sick. He stayed in his room and always kept the curtains drawn.
Yeah, I remember: he lived there with his dad. His dad was sick. He collected things, and all the rooms were full of stuff.
Yeah, I remember: he lived there with his dad. His dad was a writer. He wrote about sad stuff, and slept a lot in the daytime.
Yeah, I remember: he lived there when he was my age. He was happy then, but now he's sad.

scene.name: friend-home
scene.line: Yeah, I remember: his friend lived there when they were younger. He moved away for a while and when he came back she was married and had a new house. He's still friends with her but it makes him sad.

scene.name: sad-place
scene.line: Yeah, I remember: he woke up there one morning and he didn't know where he was. He was alone. He waited all day for someone to come and tell him why he was there, but nobody did, so he left at sundown.

scene.name: inside-house
scene.line: He went upstairs and he also looked around the other rooms. I played with the dog.
scene.option: What did he do upstairs?
What did he do in the kitchen?
What was the dog like?

scene.name: upstairs
scene.line: He looked in some boxes. He looked out the window. He could see the museum better than when he was downstairs â€” he could tell how it was all put together. And the cabin, too, he could see the shape of it better from up there.

scene.name: kitchen
scene.line: He just stood still for a while. He said he likes kitchens. He feels safe in the kitchen.

scene.name: dog
scene.line: His name is Homer, and you can almost see his skeleton. It's pretty cool.
Her name is Blue, and I fed her some crackers. She drools a lot.
The lady said he just follows them around. I wish I had a dog that followed me around. I'd name him something really cool like `Vladimir` or `Estragon`.

scene.name: weird-part
scene.line: Now, the part that is weird.
He said he went into the basement.
That cabin doesn't have a basement.
scene.option: He said he found a staircase in a closet.
He said he found a secret door in the floor.
He said he dug through the ground to get there.

scene.name: basement
scene.option: Then he found a rope leading down a long pit, and he climbed down.
He was surrounded by giant aphids.

scene.name: pit-rope
scene.option: It was so long, his arms got very tired, and he fell in the dark.
The walls were covered in a glowing moss.

scene.name: pit-rope-fell
scene.option: He didn't get hurt, though.
He hurt his other leg, and he couldn't walk at all.

scene.name: pit-rope-find-ground
scene.option: He crawled through a tunnel, where he found a hidden garden.
But he was surrounded by giant aphids!

scene.name: pit-rope-moss
scene.option: He tried to eat some of the moss.
He used the light of the moss to find a lake at the bottom of the pit.

scene.name: pit-rope-couldnt-walk
scene.option: So he crawled until he found a garden.
So he crawled until he found a river.

scene.name: pit-rope-eat-moss
scene.option: It made him fall asleep.
It made him confused, and he wandered around until he found a garden.

scene.name: garden
scene.option: The garden was very beautiful.
The garden was very dangerous.

scene.name: garden-beautiful
scene.option: He felt so calm, he fell asleep.
He found a tunnel leading back upstairs.

scene.name: garden-dangerous
scene.option: But he escaped, because he is very tall.
He was trapped for a long time, a prisoner in the garden. He had to sleep there.

scene.name: aphids
scene.option: But the aphids were friendly, and led him to a secret garden.
He ran away from the aphids, into a river to hide.

scene.name: rivers
scene.option: The water swept him around until he didn't know where he was, and finally he fell asleep in the water.
He was a good swimmer, so he found his way back to the cabin.

scene.name: weird-story-end-navigated
scene.line: So then he came back out of the cabin, and we said goodbye, and I didn't talk to them anymore.

scene.name: weird-story-end-wake-up
scene.line: He woke up on the floor of the cabin. He came back outside, and we said goodbye, and I didn't talk to them anymore.
